formatDescription: INTREPID Standard Information Files are a format developed by Australian company Intrepid Geophysics, used by their INTREPID software for processing and visualising geophysical data. isi files are vector files which can capture a variety of data. Every INTREPID dataset has an isi file which contains, amongst other information, the parameter values for the dataset.
provenanceCompoundName: National Library of Australia / National Library of Australia

internalSignatures.name: INTREPID Standard Information File
internalSignatures.note:
BOF Absolute from beginning of file, magic bytes: MetaData Begin...Name.=
EOF Absolute from beginning of file, magic bytes: End..MetaData End..
